text: Howdy - if we are pulling in custom objects into the CMS, is there a way to include that information in a site search as well? I’m not seeing anything in the documentation. Ideally we’d be able to search across custom objects based on the various properties (use a dropdown value as a search filter).
If you create CRM object dynamic pages, those pages will be reflected in site search <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/dynamic-pages/crm-objects>

> Ideally we’d be able to search across custom objects based on the various properties (use a dropdown value as a search filter).
This sounds different from site search, however, but you can certainly build some sort of custom filtering or search that allows users to sort through custom object data. You can see an example here <https://boilerplate.HubSpotcms.com/recruiting-agency/role-listing> / <https://github.com/HubSpot/recruiting-agency-graphql-theme>
Cool, so dynamic pages just appear as a standard site_page when filtering? that’s great. The other piece I’ll explore, I may just be able to use URL prefixes to get what I need.
